page.title: 07LOCAL SERVICES IN HUMBIE
page.content: MOBLIE SHOPS VISIT THE SQUARE.A FISH VAN,BUTCHER,BAKER AND GROCER COME TWICE A WEEK FROM PATHHEAD AND TRANENT.PATHEAD IS A BIG VILLAGE FIVE MILES AWAY AND TRANENT IS A TOWN EIGHT MILES AWAY.ABOUT TWENTY FAMILIES USE THE VANS. A LIBRARY VAN FROM HADDINGTON ALSO COMES.IT VISITS THE SCHOOL EVERY FORTNIGHT.MOST OF US GET THREE BOOKS EACH BUT ONLY TEN OF THE FAMILIES WE INTERVIEWED MAKE USE OF IT. OF THE PEOPLE IN OUR SURVEY VERY FEW USE THE BUSES.ONLY FOUR BUSES A DAY GO FROM HUMBIE TO DALKEITH AND THEN ON TO EDINBURGH.THE HADDINGTON SERVICE RUNS ONLY ON TWO DAYS EACH WEEK SO A CAR IS ESSENTIAL FOR PEOPLE WHO LIVE HERE.
